meanings.sent1: She wanted to equalize the number of candies between her and her brother.
meanings.sent2: The teacher used a scale to equalize the weights of the objects.
meanings.sent3: The race to equalize the number of cookies between the two friends was on!
meanings.sent4: His kind words helped equalize the tension in the room.
meanings.sent5: The magic wand had the power to equalize everything it touched.

meanings.sent1: He adjusted the table legs to equalize its height.
meanings.sent2: The landscaper worked hard to equalize the ground for the new playground.
meanings.sent3: The cat tried to equalize the surface of the blanket before lying down.
meanings.sent4: The rain helped equalize the water levels in the pond.
meanings.sent5: The carpenter used a level to equalize the shelf before placing the books.

meanings.definition: To make the same in quantity, size, or value
meanings.sent1: The store aimed to equalize the prices of the products for fairness.
meanings.sent2: The siblings decided to equalize the portions of cake for each guest.
meanings.sent3: The magician tried to equalize the lengths of the scarves for his trick.
meanings.sent4: The negotiation was successful in equalizing the benefits for both parties.
meanings.sent5: The artist used a ruler to equalize the lengths of the lines in the drawing.
